title: Rodovia Carvalho Pinto
text:
Rodovia Governador Carvalho Pinto (officially designated <a href="SP-070">SP-070</a>) is a <a href="highway">highway</a> in the state of <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Paulo%20%28state%29">São Paulo</a>, <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>.
It is a continuation of the <a href="Rodovia%20Ayrton%20Senna">Rodovia Ayrton Senna</a> (also SP-070), near the city of <a href="Guararema">Guararema</a> and ends by merging with <a href="Rodovia%20Presidente%20Dutra">Rodovia Presidente Dutra</a>, which connects the cities of <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Paulo%20%28city%29">São Paulo</a> and <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>; and <a href="Rodovia%20Floriano%20Rodrigues%20Pinheiro">Rodovia Floriano Rodrigues Pinheiro</a> (SP-123), which connects <a href="Taubat%C3%A9">Taubaté</a> to <a href="Campos%20do%20Jord%C3%A3o">Campos do Jordão</a>. The cities served by the highway are <a href="Guararema">Guararema</a>, <a href="Jacare%C3%AD">Jacareí</a>, <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Jos%C3%A9%20dos%20Campos">São José dos Campos</a>, <a href="Ca%C3%A7apava">Caçapava</a> and Taubaté.
The highway was built in order to relieve the traffic saturation of the <a href="Presidente%20Dutra%20Highway">Presidente Dutra Highway</a>, and is the main thoroughfare used by the <a href="paulistas">paulistas</a> who wish to travel to the <a href="beach">beach</a>es and cities near the <a href="South%20Atlantic%20Ocean">South Atlantic Ocean</a> of the Northern coast of the state (<a href="Rodovia%20dos%20Tamoios">Rodovia dos Tamoios</a>, SP-099), as well as to other cities of the <a href="Para%C3%ADba%20do%20Sul">Paraíba River</a> valley, such as <a href="Paraibuna">Paraibuna</a> and <a href="Jambeiro">Jambeiro</a> on the <a href="plateau">plateau</a> of <a href="Serra%20do%20Mar">Serra do Mar</a>, and to the mountain <a href="resort">resort</a>s in the <a href="Mantiqueira">Mantiqueira</a> mountain range, such as <a href="Santo%20Antonio%20do%20Pinhal">Santo Antonio do Pinhal</a> and <a href="Campos%20do%20Jord%C3%A3o">Campos do Jordão</a>, via the <a href="Rodovia%20Floriano%20Rodrigues%20Pinheiro">Rodovia Floriano Rodrigues Pinheiro</a>.
The highway honours one of the former governors of the state of São Paulo, <a href="Carlos%20Alberto%20Alves%20de%20Carvalho%20Pinto">Carlos Alberto Alves de Carvalho Pinto</a>.
It was managed and maintained by <a href="DERSA">DERSA</a>, a state-owned company, until June 18, 2009. Now it's maintained by <a href="Ecopistas">Ecopistas</a>, but is a <a href="toll%20road">toll road</a>.
